topics.body:
"Old, but terrifying story.":http://weebstories.tumblr.com/post/54999609459/nope-chan

I know you're probably thinking "But Brother, anyone could have faked that story!" And you're right. But there seems to be some frank truth in the way that the story is written, and besides, I wouldn't put this type of behavior past a mentally disturbed individual, but even if it's not true...it's still creepy.

Weaboos, man.
topics.author: 5041b54f7f123b77af00a442

topics.body:
"@And Brother I Hurt People":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5308010a63687205f5310000#post_5308010a63687205f5310000


I only had one stalker in my entire and relatively short and boring life. It never got to the level the stroy describes, partly because I don't really pride myself on what I did to solve the problem... But I know things tend to get a lot nastier than that, so it might seem hard to find it real depending if you never had dealt with that stuff before, but to those we actually did... yeah, sometimes it gets like that
topics.author: 4fdfbf92945b7075d50036e4

topics.body:
"@And Brother I Hurt People":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5308010a63687205f5310000#post_5308010a63687205f5310000
I'd say that the realistic feeling of that story makes it more terrifying than most creepypastas i've read.
You really get the feeling that it might actually happen toyou.

topics.body:
_Maybe_ i'm being paranoid, but i've noticed that whenever i sit down to draw, more often than not the light is coming from the left, making my hand cast its shadow directly on top of my drawing. Which is annoying as hell.

It's the right-handed man's world.
